Posts.Content: Jun 17, 2016 11:19AM llmedeir wrote: I had three aunts die from breast cancer, so I opted to have the BRCA testing done. When it came back positive, it was a very difficult decision to remove "perfectly healthy" breasts. After surgery, lab results showed cancer had begun to form in my left breast. If not for the "perfectly healthy" decision, we would be having a different discussion right now. I think genetic testing is confusing and only you can make the right decision for yourself - but I'm thankful every day I made the one I did
Posts.Title: Fam History, BRCA 1/2+, I'm - but DR still wants PBMastectomy?? 4BoysMama llmedeir

Posts.Content: llmedeir wrote: I had a double mastectomy two years ago now with implants. I have recently developed a painful lump on my nipple. Seeing my doctor today, she thinks it's just regrowth of breast tissue - but has scheduled me for some tests. Has anyone heard of this before? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Regrowth of breast tissue? llmedeir llmedeir

Posts.Content: Jun 17, 2016 02:10PM llmedeir wrote: I had decided to have a double mastectomy after BRACA1 testing, along with loosing all three of my aunts to breast cancer. It was a hard decision and wasn't sure I was making the right one. After the sugary, testing came back that I had cancer in my left breast. Thank god I made the right decision
